data.title: Manners first; arrest gripe; hole in the heart; price shock
data.description: A well-mannered gold thief in Samut Sakhon took his shoes off outside the shop because a sign told him to do so.

data.title: Kingdom climbs to 41st place in Global Innovation Index
data.description: Thailand was ranked 41 among 133 economies featured in the  Global Innovation Index  (GII) 2024, its highest place in a decade, the National Innovation Agency (NIA) has said.

data.title: Bangkok City Council plans 'Little India'
data.description: Bangkok City Council plans to promote Phra Nakhon district

data.title: Govt initiative uses fly larvae as novel solution to mounting prison waste
data.description: The Department of Corrections (DoC) has partnered with the Department of Climate Change and Environment (DCCE) to implement the "Green Prison" initiative, which involves the use of black soldier fly larvae to dispose of organic waste in jail.

data.title: DHSS screens plastic surgery ads
data.description: The Department of Health Service Support (DHSS) is screening online ads and promotions published by so-called beauty agencies and gurus about plastic surgery services.

data.title: Minister hails free lunch programme
data.description: The education ministry has given assurances that  students  will receive proper  meals  under next year

data.title: Ex-MFP leader slams Thaksin's comments
data.description: Chaithawat Tulathon, a Progressive Movement member and a People

data.title: Advocates blame lax law enforcement for high volume of road fatalities
data.description: Road accident  prevention advocates have called for stiffer enforcement of  road safety  laws as  traffic accidents  still exact a gruesome toll, with 48 fatalities registered per day on average now, according to a forum.

data.title: HM King, Queen to visit China
data.description: Their Majesties the King and Queen will visit China at the invitation of the Chinese government next year when the two countries will mark the 50th anniversary of their diplomatic relations, says Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

data.title: Boys ‘lured to perform in obscene videos’
data.description: YASOTHON - Seven transgender women have been arrested for allegedly luring boys into filming  obscene videos  and selling the content to a private group.

data.title: iCon victims’ advocate charged with extortion
data.description: A woman who heads an organisation that was helping victims of  The iCon Group  recover money has been arrested on suspicion of extorting payouts from executives of the direct sales company.

data.title: One killed in shuttle bus plunge
data.description: SAKON NAKHON - One person died and 25 others were injured after an electric shuttle bus lost control and plunged down a steep slope near Wat Phra Tha Pek in Phana Nikhom district.

data.title: Full Moon Party attracts over 9,000 tourists
data.description: SURAT THANI — The popular Full Moon Party and the Loy Krathong festival on Koh Phangan drew more than 9,000 tourists on Friday night, with the situation returning to normal by morning despite rumours of a possible threat to Israeli tourists on the island.

data.title: 500,000 krathong floats collected in Bangkok waterways
data.description: A total of 514,590 krathong floats were collected from Bangkok waterways after Friday

data.title: Thailand detains 70 illegal migrants believed to be Rohingya from Myanmar
data.description: Thailand arrested 70 illegal immigrants, including 30 children, suspected to be Rohingya from Myanmar on an island in the country

data.title: Government to okay JTC for Cambodia talks
data.description: The government is expected to approve the establishment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia over the development of disputed maritime areas in the Gulf of Thailand during a cabinet meeting on Tuesday.

data.title: Man admits killing, eating dog
data.description: A man in Chiang Rai was arrested for animal cruelty after killing a dog he recently adopted for its meat.

data.title: Govt aims for 25% drop in hotspots
data.description: The government aims to reduce hotspots by 25% this dry season compared to last year to mitigate air pollution, according to Deputy Prime Minister and Digital Economy and Society Minister Prasert Jantararuangtong.

data.title: Government to ramp up student swaps
data.description: The Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation (MHESI) aims to increase student exchanges with Italian universities in the areas of medical technology innovation and energy science.

data.title: Several decisions to make
data.description: National politics has been gripped by three major issues, two of which are interconnected and could be doomed to failure.

data.title: Cocoa added to special watchlist
data.description: The committee on agriculture and cooperatives policy and development has added cocoa to the list of crops under the supervision of a sub-committee on horticultural crops.

data.title: Minimum wage to 'hit B400 as NY gift'
data.description: The Labour Ministry aims to increase the daily wage to 400 baht nationwide on Jan 1 as a New Year

data.title: Phumtham urges DTI to spearhead defence industry
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai yesterday urged the Defence Technology Institute (DTI) to link up with the armed forces and the private sector in developing the country
